intro: Erigeron tardus, commonly known as late blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early fall, featuring blue to purple ray florets and yellow disk florets. Erigeron tardus is often found in the eastern and central United States, where it plays a role in supporting pollinators.
